data.title: Take Note
data.statement:
You will be given [[N]] pieces of information separated by spaces. Each information [[item]] consists of one or two characters: a <<key>> as the first character, and optionally either a <<store>> character or {{=}} as the <<clear>> symbol.

If the [[item]] consists of <<key>> and <<store>> characters, repeat these in output and store the value for future use with that key.
If the [[item]] consists of a <<key>> only, output the key followed by the corresponding stored character, if any.
If the [[item]] consists of a <<key>> and the {{=}} symbol, clear the stored value for that key, and output only the key.

testCases.title: Digit hash
testCases.testIn:
12
A# B C1 A B2 C A2 B C3 A B# C
testCases.testOut: A# B C1 A# B2 C1 A2 B2 C3 A2 B# C3

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
12
A# B C3 A B1 C A2 B C2 A B# C
testCases.testOut: A# B C3 A# B1 C3 A2 B1 C2 A2 B# C2

testCases.title: Digit equals
testCases.testIn:
13
A= B C1 A B2 C A2 B C3 A B= C B
testCases.testOut: A B C1 A B2 C1 A2 B2 C3 A2 B C3 B

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn:
13
A= B C3 A B1 C A2 B C2 A B= C B
testCases.testOut: A B C3 A B1 C3 A2 B1 C2 A2 B C2 B

testCases.title: Ensemble
testCases.testIn:
15
G Db C# Gb C= D F# G F= C D G# F D= G
testCases.testOut: G Db C# Gb C Db F# Gb F C Db G# F D G#

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
15
G C# Db Gb F# C= D F= G C D G# F G D=
testCases.testOut: G C# Db Gb F# C Db F Gb C Db G# F G# D

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loopline N item:word(2)
write output
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]]
<<Line 2:>> Each [[item]] (of which there are [[N]]) separated by spaces
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> Each output (of which there are [[N]]) separated by spaces

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You will be given N pieces of information separated by spaces. Each information item consists of one or two characters: a key as the first character, and optionally either a store character or = as the clear symbol.

If the item consists of key and store characters, repeat these in output and store the value for future use with that key.
If the item consists of a key only, output the key followed by the corresponding stored character, if any.
If the item consists of a key and the = symbol, clear the stored value for that key, and output only the key.
Input
Line 1: An integer N
Line 2: Each item (of which there are N) separated by spaces
Output
Line 1: Each output (of which there are N) separated by spaces
Constraints
N < 20
Each item is 1 or 2 characters long.
Example
Input
12
A# B C1 A B2 C A2 B C3 A B# C
Output
A# B C1 A# B2 C1 A2 B2 C3 A2 B# C3
